UI bug in bold printing flighttracks/operations
body:
By selecting first an operation, then double-clicking an inactive operation, and then selecting a flight track, both operation and flight-track are bolded. 

Desired state: only flight-track is bold.

title: mscolab dbase migration script missing (documentation)
body:
Older versions than MSS 8.0.0 don't have a difinition in the operations table of the "active" state.

We need to provide a migration script, or documentation how to update existing databases.


msui 8.0.0 can read older versions of the mscolab server and also new created databases on 8.0.0. We need only the step for updating an existing one.


We should introduce a section migrations and collect there changes for the different parts of open-mss.

title: Airspaces/Airports info downloaded from OpenAIP produces error when download size is 0KB.
body:
This was observed in this [PR](https://github.com/Open-MSS/MSS/pull/1671#issuecomment-1469562490), When we download the data of airports/airspaces in the MSUI, sometimes the file size that is downloaded is 0Kb, this only happens with the ".xml" files and not with the ".csv" files. Due to this airspaces can't be drawn and an error is thrown which states "ERROR: Tried to draw airspaces without asp files.".The function which draws the airspace is [here](https://github.com/Open-MSS/MSS/blob/develop/mslib/msui/mpl_map.py#L379).

Steps to reproduce - 

1) open msui #python mslib/msui/msui.py

2) Open top view and select airports/airspaces from (select to open control) and Update and download both airports and airspaces.

![221437815-cd963e68-8875-457b-9b86-7133d5a63489](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73490663/225405539-e7370dcc-b0cf-4c0d-9e85-419b95b3405c.gif)


3) Click on apply and check the CLI. The image is given below for reference when the error is produced.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73490663/225404622-fd2e0da6-aed1-4dec-bd6c-6723e7daf884.png)

title: docker description, add --network option
body:
I needed to set additional --network to start the msui from latest stable image

`docker run -ti --rm -e DISPLAY=$DISPLAY -v /tmp/.X11-unix/:/tmp/.X11-unix --network host openmss/mss:latest msui`

title: update our version string definition, see patch
body:
from https://github.com/conda-forge/mss-feedstock/pull/141
```
diff -ruN -x __pycache__ -x obj -x '*~' -x tags -x TAGS MSS-7.0.7.orig/mslib/version.py MSS-7.0.7/mslib/version.py
--- MSS-7.0.7.orig/mslib/version.py	2022-12-07 18:16:45.000000000 +0100
+++ MSS-7.0.7/mslib/version.py	2023-01-30 15:46:44.944598202 +0100
@@ -24,4 +24,4 @@
     See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
     limitations under the License.
 """
-__version__ = u'7.0.7.'
+__version__ = u'7.0.7'
```

Also check all code lines where we use that var.

With solving this we are compatible with recent setuptools.

and undo the fixation of setuptools in our meta.yaml

title: Remote sensing tool results in crash, if two consecutive way points are in the same horizontal position
body:
As mentioned in #1516 , I was able to provoke a crash if I was either

- cloning a way point in the table view with enabled tangent points of the remote sensing tools 
- enabling the tangent points of the remote sensing tools when having two consecutive way points in the same horizontal position

An easy workaround for me as a user is to ensure that there are no two identical consecutive way points, before enabling the remote sensing tools, but maybe it could be checked by the remote sensing tool itself?

title: Wrapping issue in side view (and linear view) when crossing 180° longitude
body:
When having a flight path crossing 180° longitude, there are missing values at these longitudes in the side view (and also in linear view), as shown in the screenshot:
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/114411636/192292022-9b2c5601-80ab-47a5-ace4-eb515c7711d4.png)

It seems like, the model data is not wrapped correctly and simply goes from -180 to +180 degrees longitude?

title: Remote sensing tool tangent points not correct west of longitude 180°
body:
I was playing around with the "Remote Sensing Tools" in the Top View window, while experiencing the following (see screenshot):
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/114411636/192284047-936cd49f-1bbc-451e-bb38-35d8f1875150.png)

As you can see, tangent point locations are only displayed correctly east of longitude 180°, when crossing 180°. Adjusting the flight track to points only east of 180°, all tangent points are shown incorrectly. West of 180°, everything seems to be fine.
Tested with version 7.0.4.

title: category shows always ANY on startup
body:
We can define the category in the configuration msui_settings.json. Currently the UI did not use this value when it is present. It always shows ANY which means all operations are in the list.

It should from the beginning preselect the category items

title: WMS server does not discard dataless layer under certain circumstances
body:
Normal behaviour: WMS server does not serve data-less layers in its capability document
Current behavour: under certain circumstances, they are listed with wrong time information, causing a later failure when trying to retrieve data.

Cause: The logic for collecting "valid times" from multiple data variables is flawed, if *only* the first checked variable has *no* data.

title: role option "delete operation" only for "creator" role
body:
The property option to delete an operation can only be done by a creator role. We have to update the menu based on the selected operation.

e.g. a viewer role can't do that, there is no need to have it activated in the menu

![viewer_option_review](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/278728/167793090-6927a61f-3bc8-4da7-829d-663fffef9320.gif)

Also update description is not possible for a viewer role. That also should be fixed in same PR.

title: Default Linear Plotting classes for different quantities share same name property
body: The name property of default linear plotting classes is defined from some abbreviation of the plotted variable, which causes overwriting of registered layers in registration.

title: MSS and WMS crashes sometimes if no coastline is present in the selected area

labels.name: upstream fix needed
labels.description: a dependency of us needs an improvement

body:
Similar to the problem described here

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/59855017/determining-if-a-coastline-is-present-when-using-basemap

I think this is an issue with basemap and/or matplotlib, but we can handle it in the proposed manner with a simple try/except ourselves.

title: mslib.mswms.utils still contains fixed units
body:
The THRESHOLDS variable of the Targets class contains values without units. This is "implicetly" defined by the UNITS tag, but this doesn't work correctly, when a different unit is specified in the generic plot.

Solution: The units tag must remove the conversion factor; instead, a unit must be given to the Thresholds, which is then converted to the actual plotting units.

Greetings from Boulder!,

In version 6.0.0 of the software when I put more than one plugin into "export_plugins": {} in the mss_settings.json file, it will always load the first plugin perfectly fine regardless of which one of my plugins I choose first, but every other one in the list after that does not install when starting up the MSS planner.  I am getting the following message box:

ERROR: Configuration
{'csv': <function load_from_csv at 0x7fc5d8571b80>, 'txt': <function import_foreflight at 0x7fc5e1b31310>}
throws <class 'ValueError'> error:
'actionImportFlightTracktxt' has already been set!

I get this message for each of my plugins (minus the first one listed in "export_plugins":{}), then the program comes all the way up, but only with the first plugin loaded.  The same happens for my "import_plugins":{} entries.

Thanks!

-Shawn Honomichl

title: Flight paths crossing the date line (longitude=180)
body:
When moving the top view map towards a shifted map that reaches over the date line (longitude=180), it is possible that the longitude registred of a way point gets below -180. A flight path whith this coordinate is correclty displayed, however the resulting side view panel is not.
The following plots show the temperature curtain for the 2 waypoints (lat:-40 lon -150) and (lat: -40, lon:130) and the same when the second lon is replaced by -230. Although the values below -180 are considered as not in the valid range in the table view, these way points can be created by clicking on the top view. For the such created invalid logitudes the sideview shows no data.
![sideview_Temperature1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32653190/146218943-a95a6fec-c5d6-442d-afa2-87f1e0c39da0.png)
![sideview_Temperature2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32653190/146218960-7ecc49ac-c048-4834-9996-db4c90658947.png)

This is important for missions near the date line e.g. in the Pacific

title: mscolab not JavaScript friendly
body:
While developing the windy plugin I encountered a few oddities of mscolab which should be solved in order to be used with JavaScript.

1. API and Websocket don't return a CORS header, which is required for communication through JavaScript.
2. Some GET endpoints require request.form data. GET requests don't have a body, as such either query string request.args or the combined request.values should be used.

title: Tests aborting silently
body:
I observed on multiple occasions the tests just aborting silently, no error output or anything, which looks something like that 
```                                                                                                                                                                                                              
mslib/_tests/test_convert.py .                                                                                                                                                                                                   [  0%]
mslib/_tests/test_index.py ..                                                                                                                                                                                                    [  0%]
mslib/_tests/test_netCDF4tools.py ........s..                                                                                                                                                                                    [  3%]
mslib/_tests/test_thermolib.py .....s                                                                                                                                                                                            [  4%]
mslib/_tests/test_utils.py ..........................                                                                                                                                                                            [ 10%]
mslib/mscolab/_tests/test_chat.py .(mssenv) mayb@icg1705:~/Desktop/MSS/MSS$
```

It seems like @aravindm711 managed to make this a consistent error on his repo which can be seen [here](https://github.com/aravindm711/MSS/runs/3142033187?check_suite_focus=true)

After some digging and debugging it seems to happen due to X11 connections breaking. Particularly with the message
`The X11 connection broke: No error (code 0)`
A log of this debug can be seen [here](https://github.com/Marilyth/MSS/runs/3141549177?check_suite_focus=true)

I haven't gotten further than that yet.

Things I tried:
- Catching the error, which is impossible
- Updating X11, which had no effect
- Throwing out test_mscolab.py which made the test pass, but obviously isn't the root of the issue

title: Test should not use the mss-core config
body:
I ran into issues today with a failing test, which was caused by my topview map appearance settings.
I would expect tests to not save or load settings persistently, as that is a hard to trace reason of error.
The error was gone after I forced tests to run on the default settings and being unable to save anything, and no other test was failing.
Is there any reason to keep the saving/loading for tests, as every test needs to be independent anyway?

title: on switch to another project not all windows closed
body:
enabling one Project and opening a tableview, sideview, topview, chat

and then enable an other project does not close all windows.
sometimes one of tableview or sideview persists

one window view opened and changing the project closes that. This happens only when multiple window views are open.

title: mscolab project name with blanks
body:
It seems, that a mscolab project needs to be named without spaces or "special characters". This is displayed in the selection box when choosing "Add Project". However, if accitently a project name including a blank is typed in, there comse the error message "The path already exists"
If project names need to be without blanks, please drop a meaningful error message

title: mscolab connect/disconnect signal leak
body:
On each connection or disconnection to a server, the signal for the buttons is switched between connect_handler and disconnect_handler.
However the old signal is never cleaned up. So after a while a single button click will connect and disconnect an arbitrary amount of times, causing the whole application to slow down.

title: After mscolab logout, default password is cleared
body:
when a user has a config for username and password than this is prefilled indo the login fields. When the user logs out the username persists and the password is cleared.

We want that the user can easily login again.

title: mss-dev docker image is failing
body:
About a week ago the develop docker images began to fail due to a bus error, as can be seen [here](https://github.com/Open-MSS/dockerhub/runs/2288875615?check_suite_focus=true).
A workaround I found was to downgrade pyqt and qt from 5.12 to 5.9. The image is not failing anymore as can be seen [here](https://github.com/Marilyth/dockerhub/runs/2289510813?check_suite_focus=true).
The testing image on the other hand is running fine with pyqt and qt on 5.12, as can be seen [here](https://github.com/Open-MSS/dockerhub/runs/2288875723?check_suite_focus=true).
I derive thereby that qt and pyqt are not the actual cause of the issue, but I am not sure what is.

title: Dock-widgets in TableView prevent TableView from closing upon application exit
body:
Steps to reproduce the problem:
1) Open a TableView
2) Open a dock widget
3) "Quit" the MainWindow
Expected Outcome:
4) All windows close
Outcome;
4) TableView window remains visible.

The TopView has dockwidgets that work in this regard. One should be able to transfer the proper handling from TopView to TableView.

title: MSCOLAB Add project dialogue has strange location for selected filename
body: Adding an existing file as a project shows the name of the file in the description box.

title: QT Version mismatch between different OS
body:
We recognized today that we get on windows on a fresh installation 
- pyqt 5.12.3
- qt 5.12.9

and on linux
- pyqt 5.9.2
- qt 5.9.7

ui files using  QSpinBox with the 5.12.x designer created have an attribute StepType
 the conversion to the pyui has than an Attribute setStepType which does not exists in older versions.

```
AttributeError: 'QtCustomDoubleSpinBox' object has no attribute 'setStepType'.
```
because setStepType was introduced in [Qt 5.12 ](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qspinbox.html#setStepType)

title: MSS Config Editor does not properly close
body:
When the config editor was opened, a reference to the editor is stored in the main GUI, which is not removed upon destruction of the editor. When the main GUI is closed, the Editor is thus closed again, in some, fashion, which causes another "are you sure..." dialog to be presented to the, confused, user.

The Configuration Editor should be blocking and provide an option to restart the GUI when the configuration was changed.

In my version, there also seems to be some issues with saving the configuration.

The Editor should have an obvious way to be closed in addition to the window manager "x" in the title bar like "save and exit" or "apply and exit".

A review for other non-fails should be performed.

title: Check that each dimension has a coordinate dimension (netCDF4tools.py): allow to skip for vars in skip_dim_check
body:
When grib-files of parameters on model-levels (ml) of ECMWF are converted to necdf using cdo, there are 2 additional dimensions (nhyi, nhym) without having a coordinate variable.  The "check that each dimension has a coordinate dimension" in netCDF4tools.py fails for such files because this "check" does not ignore dimNames in skip_dim_check. Adding skip_dim_check worked for me.

`# Check that each dimension has a coordinate dimension`
`for dimName in masterDims:`
  ` if dimName not in cdfm-variables and dimName not in skip-dim_check:`
  `  raise IOError("dimension '{}' has no coordinate variable in master '{}'".format(dimName,master))`

title: only if a mss_settings.json is defined it should be loaded
body:
The last change to the editor introduced a mandatory mss_settings.json file which we don't have by default.

It should only be loaded when it exists. 

While we don't have automated tests on stable this was not shown up.

title: fix typo of word "collaboration" in documents
body:
We should use the word "collaboration" instead of "colaboration" in all descriptions.

We keep the word mscolab for the module etc.

title: mscolab chat upload/download  did not use configured "filepicker_default": "fs"
body:
This is similar to
https://github.com/Open-MSS/MSS/issues/636

if we configure in mss_settings.json the "fs" filepicker this is currently for mscolab chat upload/download ignored

To verify this you need a config file mss_settings.json to be stored in $HOME/.config/mss

{
 "filepicker_default": "fs"
}


mss_qt.get_open_filename needs to be used

source to look at
https://github.com/Open-MSS/MSS/blob/develop/mslib/msui/mscolab_project.py

please check if the test needs a fix too

title: Editing mscolab Url must be blocked on connect
body:
We need to disable editing of the mcolab url once connected. And enable it on disconnect.

![block_editing_of_url](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/278728/105840583-84760f80-5fd3-11eb-9bda-edfe4e10d7e3.gif)


https://github.com/Open-MSS/MSS/blob/develop/mslib/msui/mscolab.py

title: mscolab export/import did not use configured "filepicker_default": "fs"
body:
if we configure in mss_settings.json the "fs" filepicker this is currently for mscolab export/import ignored

To verify this you need a config file mss_settings.json to be stored in $HOME/.config/mss

```
{
 "filepicker_default": "fs"
}
```


The used QtWidgets.QFileDialog.getSaveFileName needs to be replaced by mss_qt.get_save_filename 
also QtWidgets.QFileDialog.getOpenFileName by the one of mss_qt.

To compare how that file picker looks like, you can look at it by e.g. save of topview.

fix is needed for:
https://github.com/Open-MSS/MSS/blob/develop/mslib/msui/mscolab.py
and look also on the test.

title: configuration editor did not close on quit of the loader
body:
The configuration editor should be closed on quit of the main window.

But if there are not saved changes it has to ask to store them and wait for 60 seconds

title: configuration file update did not initialize msui
body:
After saving a new configuration the msui is not restarted as in the past and the new data is not used.

restart is one option, without a restart and using the new configuration would be good too.

title: configuration file loader does not load the default
body: if a mss_settings.json exists its content gets not loaded into the UI

title: in development documentation replace pep8 by flake8
body:

This should be changed to flake8  e.g. `pytest --flake8`

or pycodestyle

`pycodestyle --show-source --show-pep8  mslib`

title: user id needs to be always unique
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/588) by Reimar Bauer (Bitbucket: [ReimarBauer](https://bitbucket.org/ReimarBauer), GitHub: [ReimarBauer](https://github.com/ReimarBauer)).**

----------------------------------------

We have to enumerate or use a complex number or something else to get always on user creation a new id.

test\_server.test\_uniqueness\_of\_user\_id shows that we currently can ran in a situation where a new user gets the id of a deleted user.

‌

Because Names of users are not unique we can ran in a situation that persons can get on one provider an identical email address. So the belonging “id” to content on our system needs to be always an unused new one.

‌

title: Table View Doesn't Properly Update when Adjusting Altitude in the Vertical View
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/582) by Shawn Honomichl (Bitbucket: [Shawn](https://bitbucket.org/Shawn), GitHub: [Shawn](https://github.com/Shawn)).**

----------------------------------------

When an aircraft performance file is loaded, adjusting the altitude in the side view does not update ‘Leg time’, ‘Cum. time’, ‘Time’, ‘Rem. fuel’, etc.  These should be updated if a performance file contains the proper entries in the “climb”, “descent”, and “cruise” fields.  The performance file is attached for reference.

‌

```
def load_from_xml_data(self, xml_content, name="Flight track"):

----------------------------------------

* test\_insert\_point in test\_sideview.py failing due to invalid coordinate. The problem exists due to different window sizes on different machines
* test\_mscolab\_project.py failing due to error in `_activate_project_at_index`. This requires a mouseDoubleClick instead of enter key press
* `test_server_service_cache` in test\_wms\_control.py failing because get capabilities button is not pressed after writing the correct URL in wms url box. This leaves the retrieve button to remain disabled.

title: improve documentation of mscolab
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/548) by Reimar Bauer (Bitbucket: [ReimarBauer](https://bitbucket.org/ReimarBauer), GitHub: [ReimarBauer](https://github.com/ReimarBauer)).**

----------------------------------------

A user pointed that the link in “steps to run” is invalid. It may point to the config below.

[https://mss.readthedocs.io/en/stable/mscolab.html](https://mss.readthedocs.io/en/stable/mscolab.html)

‌

‌

In a mail I decribed the needed steps. The one who fixes this, please verify my findings about hardcoded pathes. If that is reproduced file an additional bugreport. 

It is welcome to improve the documentation. Usually someone new finds problems we just escaped automaticly.

‌

That’s from my answer of the mail.

You need sqlite3 or postgres on your system. The example is defined for  
sqlite3 and comments show the setup for postgres.

\$ apt install sqlite3

Currently this mscolab\_settings.py file need to be stored in $HOME/mss  
and also the paths for the DATA\_DIR should not become changed. This is  
somewhere hard coded. We will improve this. This is only for now.

export PYTHONPATH=to the absolute path of $HOME/mss

Then you can start the server by

[https://mss.readthedocs.io/en/stable/mscolab.html#instructions-to-use-mscolab-wsgi](https://mss.readthedocs.io/en/stable/mscolab.html#instructions-to-use-mscolab-wsgi)

gunicorn -b [0.0.0.0:8083](http://0.0.0.0:8083/) server:app

or call the builtin server mscolab

In the mss gui you have to use the server url and first add yourself as  
user.  Then login as this user. Afterwards add a project. The project is  
shown in the list, double click it.  
Important!! enable autosave

The common navigation elements of the views are on the bottom.

----------------------------------------

The base of our meta.yaml is always only

[https://github.com/conda-forge/mss-feedstock/blob/master/recipe/meta.yaml](https://github.com/conda-forge/mss-feedstock/blob/master/recipe/meta.yaml)

and maybe patches there. There may be patches because of the setup of the CIs.

This task has to be reviewed on any release we do. As our order is to tag a release and than build on the conda-forge channel we can only in this order see what changes we may need. 

The documentation has to get a hint too.

----------------------------------------

MSWMS 1.8.2 combined for a SideView plot a al layer of small longitudinal extent with an sfc layer of global extent but picked the wrong longitudes in the larger sfc layer.

MSWMS should \(preferred\) select the correct data or diagnose the inconsistency and abort.

title: mss pyui crashes when quitting
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/505) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

When MSS is quit without opening an msolab window it crashes with the error message:

```
Fatal error in MSS 1.9.0 on Linux-4.19.0-6-amd64-x86_64-with-debian-10.1
Python 3.7.4 (default, Aug 13 2019, 20:35:49) 
[GCC 7.3.0]

Please report bugs in MSS to https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss

Information about the fatal error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "mss_pyui.py", line 424, in closeEvent
    if self.mscolab_window is not None:
AttributeError: 'MSSMainWindow' object has no attribute 'mscolab_window'
```

I think it should also crash in case that the mscolab window was first opened and then closed - it didn’t when testing for this just now, but I do not see how the reference to the window is set to none by anybody.

‌

I deem this critical as every “normal” user will experience this crash undermining the trust in the software.

title: mscolab server command crashes
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/491) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

There is an error with respect to the “app” variable missing. Changing the code of the stub to

‌

```
#!/home/icg173/anaconda3/envs/mss-1.9.0/bin/python
  
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
import re
import sys

from mslib.mscolab.server import main, app

if __name__ == '__main__':
    sys.argv[0] = re.sub(r'(-script\.pyw?|\.exe)?$', '', sys.argv[0])
    sys.exit(main(app))
```

Fixes the problem, but we need a clean solution that generates a\) the proper stub or b\) doesn’t require the app argument in the call to main\(\).

  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\mssenv\lib\site-packages\skyfield\iokit.py", line 505, in download
    raise IOError('cannot get {0} because {1}'.format(url, e))
OSError: cannot get http://maia.usno.navy.mil/ser7/deltat.data because <urlopen error [Errno 11001] getaddrinfo failed>
```

The problem is not reproducable on another Windows PC with the same pyhton and mss version installed, so it is also likely that I did not configure everything in the proper way - but I don’t know what I could have missed.

title: Fix dependency issue of python-socketio, flask-socketio
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/466) by Shivashis Padhi (Bitbucket: [plant99](https://bitbucket.org/plant99), GitHub: [plant99](https://github.com/plant99)).**

----------------------------------------

Flask socketio is built on top of python-socketio. We are using both libraries, while installing flask-socketio, the version of python-socketio is being downgraded. Figure out the best way to install and use both.

title: Visual distortion after changing side view settings
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/464) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

When changing side view settings the flight path zooms seemingly to the beginning before being displaced properly.

title: MSS ignores skip variable dimension check
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/461) by Shawn Honomichl (Bitbucket: [Shawn](https://bitbucket.org/Shawn), GitHub: [Shawn](https://github.com/Shawn)).**

----------------------------------------

Getting the following error message:

Error message: 'dimension 'nbnd' has no coordinate variable in master '/Users/shawnh/mss/testdata/f.e22.beta02.FWSD.f09\_f09\_mg17.cesm2\_2\_beta02.forecast.001.cam.h3.2019-08-30-00000.nc'''.

The following does not work in mss\_wms\_settings.py:

mslib.mswms.dataaccess.DefaultDataAccess.\_mfDatasetArgsDict\["skipDimCheck"\].extend\(\["chars", "nbnd"\]\)

‌

title: tangent points not properly calculated at longitudes != 0
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/451) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

North/southward pointing tangent points are shifted significantly away from the zero meridian.

title: disable progressbar in skyfield Loader
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/449) by Reimar Bauer (Bitbucket: [ReimarBauer](https://bitbucket.org/ReimarBauer), GitHub: [ReimarBauer](https://github.com/ReimarBauer)).**

----------------------------------------

We have to disable the progressbar of the Loader of skyfield, this sometimes crashes the msui started on windows as desktop application.

title: barb plots show barbs outside range of valid data
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/443) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

Plots using barbs show barbs outside the valid range of available data. E.g. the standard geopotential height and horizontal wind speed plot.

This is likely a matplotlib/basemap issue, but we should work around it.

```
pyproj_datadir = os.getenv('PROJ_LIB', pyproj.datadir.pyproj_datadir)

```
import os
if "PROJ_LIB" not in os.environ:

body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/432) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

There are at least two scenarios, where the server re-reads the files repeatedly.

One with 1.8.0 version where a file with different init time is provided and one with 1.8.1, in case the files are not in the local directory.

title: SideView options allow for illegal vertical range
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/430) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

Vertical range selection is SideView is communicated in hPa to the Server.

This allows for no “higher” altitude than 1 hPa.

In case that pressure altitude/flight level is used for selection higher altitudes than 1 hPa might be selected that cause the server to fail in produding plots.

A limit to 1hPa altitudes must be implemented for the other altitude types.

Second, one might think of using a different way of communication vertical range, but this should be backwards-compatible and is not a bug, but a feature.P

title: mss server raises error once, when asked for available, but previously unknown data
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/425) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

The server looks for new data, when the capability document is requested, or when data for an unknown timestep etc is requested for a plot.

In the latter case, the server still balks on the first try and only succeeds on the second.

‌

```
2019-07-15 13:14:10,900 (mss_plot_driver._set_time:145): 	variable 'low_cloud_area_fraction' requires input file '2019-07-13T12:00:00.an.sfc.nc'
2019-07-15 13:14:10,900 (mss_plot_driver._set_time:147): ERROR: file '2019-07-13T12:00:00.an.sfc.nc' does not exist
2019-07-15 13:14:10,900 (wms.produce_plot:428): ERROR: <class 'OSError'> [Errno file '%s' does not exist] 2019-07-13T12:00:00.an.sfc.nc
2019-07-15 13:14:10,901 (wms.produce_plot:429): Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/mss-campaigns2019/miniconda3/envs/stable/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mslib/mswms/wms.py", line 425, in produce_plot
    return_format=return_format)
  File "/home/mss-campaigns2019/miniconda3/envs/stable/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mslib/mswms/mss_plot_driver.py", line 540, in set_plot_parameters
    return_format=return_format)
  File "/home/mss-campaigns2019/miniconda3/envs/stable/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mslib/mswms/mss_plot_driver.py", line 251, in set_plot_parameters
    self._set_time(init_time, valid_time)
  File "/home/mss-campaigns2019/miniconda3/envs/stable/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mslib/mswms/mss_plot_driver.py", line 148, in _set_time
    raise IOError(u"file '%s' does not exist", short_filename)
OSError: [Errno file '%s' does not exist] 2019-07-13T12:00:00.an.sfc.nc
```

The problem is that the routine stores a list of all known files before retrieving the required files for the requested data. During the request stage, the list of known files may be extended, unbeknownst to the calling routine.

This likely stems from a time, when the filenames were constructed according to a pattern. Current implementations typically do not return not-existing filenames.

title: epsg code support warnings too annoying in practice
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/421) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

When working with legacy EPGS stereographic codes and legacy MSS servers, a warning pops up for every retrieved map. This does not work in practice.

I propose to add another button to disable the warnings for the current session. A better way would be to upgrade legacy MSS servers to the current release version, but that is beyond the control of the MSS development team.

I deem this a usability bug and propose to fix it in stable.r

title: cartopy bounding box setting with set_extent broken for stereographic projections
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/420) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

Using the cartopy set\_extent method with the bounding box coordiantes given as lat/lon tuples for the corners fails with seemingly random results. Typically, the left lower corner is ill-placed for Nothern Stereographic plots.

Workaround by manually computing the coodinates in projection coordinates and calling set\_extent using those.

Example:

```python
import os
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from netCDF4 import Dataset as netcdf_dataset
import numpy as np

from cartopy import config
import cartopy.crs as ccrs


# get the path of the file. It can be found in the repo data directory.
fname = os.path.join(config["repo_data_dir"],
                     'netcdf', 'HadISST1_SST_update.nc')

dataset = netcdf_dataset(fname)
sst = dataset.variables['sst'][0, :, :]
lats = dataset.variables['lat'][:]
lons = dataset.variables['lon'][:]

prj = ccrs.Stereographic(central_longitude=0, central_latitude=90)

fig = plt.figure()
ax = fig.add_subplot(1, 1, 1, projection=prj)
print("default", ax.get_extent())
ax.set_extent([45, -135, 0, 0], ccrs.PlateCarree())
print("set1", ax.get_extent())
ax.contour(lons, lats, sst, 60, transform=ccrs.PlateCarree())
ax.coastlines()

fig = plt.figure()
ax = fig.add_subplot(1, 1, 1, projection=prj)
print("default", ax.get_extent())
coords = prj.transform_points(                                                                
    ccrs.PlateCarree(), np.asarray([45, -135]), np.asarray([0, 0]))
ax.set_extent([coords[0, 0], coords[1, 0], coords[0, 1], coords[1, 1]], prj)
print("set2", ax.get_extent())
ax.contour(lons, lats, sst, 60, transform=ccrs.PlateCarree())
ax.coastlines()

plt.show()
```

title: mss cannot start in root environment, PROJ_LIB Path, KeyError
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/360) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

Starting mss with a fresh installation crashes with Anaconda3 and Windows7 with the following error message:

```
(mss-1.7.3) C:\Users\icg173>mss
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\icg173\Anaconda3\envs\mss-1.7.3\Scripts\mss-script.py", line 6, in <module>
    from mslib.msui.mss_pyui import main
  File "C:\Users\icg173\Anaconda3\envs\mss-1.7.3\lib\site-packages\mslib\msui\mss_pyui.py", line 49, in <module>
    from mslib.msui.mss_qt import ui_mainwindow as ui
  File "C:\Users\icg173\Anaconda3\envs\mss-1.7.3\lib\site-packages\mslib\msui\mss_qt.py", line 40, in <module>
    from mslib.utils import config_loader, FatalUserError
  File "C:\Users\icg173\Anaconda3\envs\mss-1.7.3\lib\site-packages\mslib\utils.py", line 47, in <module>
    import mpl_toolkits.basemap.pyproj as pyproj
  File "C:\Users\icg173\Anaconda3\envs\mss-1.7.3\lib\site-packages\mpl_toolkits\basemap\__init__.py", line 146, in <modu
le>
    epsgf = open(os.path.join(pyproj.pyproj_datadir,'epsg'))
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'C:/Users/icg173/Anaconda3/envs/mss-1.7.3\\share\\proj\\epsg'
```

The error occurs with pyproj package in version 1.9.5.1-py36hb98d9bb_1

Workaround: Install pyproj in version 1.9.5.1-py36_0 by

```
    conda install pyproj=1.9.5.1=py36_0
```

The error itself is triggered within basemap and is caused by pyproj storing the wrong directory location
`
'C:/Users/icg173/Anaconda3/envs/mss-1.7.3\\share\\proj'
`
instead of
`
'C:/Users/icg173/Anaconda3/envs/mss-1.7.3\\Library\\share'
`
(and/or it is stored wrongly, but that isn't important from our perspective).

I could alternatively fix it by patching the file
`
<mssenv>/Lib/site-packages/pyproj/datadir.py
`
with the proper path
`
pyproj_datadir="<mssenv>/Library/share"
`
with <mssenv> being the path to my mss environment (e.g. C:\Users\username\Anaconda3\envs\mss-1.7.3).

title: mswms crashes by wrong URLs for py3
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/339) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

In my current py3 setup, the mswms is first triggered with an "empty" request before the getCapability request. This causes the following issues, crashing the thread:

a) The request is a None, which has no "lower" attribute.
b) The default return value is a unicode string instead of a byte string. I.e. the empy string needs to be "encoded".

title: matplotlib 2.2/basemap 1.0.7 incompatibility
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/329) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

By default conda installs the current matplotlib 2.2.x together with basemap 1.0.7.
This causes MSS to fail due to a deprecated call in basemap 1.0.7.

One should use the more recent basemap version 1.1 instead or fix the matplotlib version to <= 2.1

If the next release will not arrive shortly, we should also fix the update the meta.yaml of the last stable branch.

title: MSS crahes opening Top View if MKL libraries are not available  on Anaconda with osx-64 (OSX 10.10)
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/304) by Erik Kretschmer (Bitbucket: [geogob](https://bitbucket.org/geogob), GitHub: [geogob](https://github.com/geogob)).**

----------------------------------------

Here is a dependency check possibly missing and/or an issue with Anaconda2

Running MSS 1.6.2 on Anaconda with osx-64 (OSX 10.10). All clean and new installation.
MSS can start fine and the table view can be opened.
As soon as one opens the top view, the process crashes with the following error in the console (no error in the MSS log):


```
#!python

Intel MKL FATAL ERROR: Cannot load libmkl_intel_thread.dylib.
```

The MKL libraries are not supported on osx-64 10.10 and require OSX >= 10.12.

Replacing the numpy and scipy in Anaconda with the nomkl versions fixed the issue:

```
#!bash

(mssenv) ekmacpro:/ kretsch$ conda install nomkl
Fetching package metadata .............
Solving package specifications: .

Package plan for installation in environment /Users/kretsch/anaconda2/envs/mssenv:

The following NEW packages will be INSTALLED:

    nomkl: 1.0-0                

The following packages will be DOWNGRADED:

    numpy: 1.13.1-py27hd567e90_2 --> 1.13.1-py27_nomkl_0      [nomkl]
    scipy: 0.19.1-py27hf01dd8f_3 --> 0.19.1-np113py27_nomkl_0 [nomkl]

Proceed ([y]/n)? y

nomkl-1.0-0.ta 100% |##########################################################################################################| Time: 0:00:00 401.35 kB/s
numpy-1.13.1-p 100% |##########################################################################################################| Time: 0:00:02   1.68 MB/s
scipy-0.19.1-n 100% |##########################################################################################################| Time: 0:00:02   5.67 MB/s
```

With the nomkl downgrade, the top view works as expected.

title: Installing on osx-64 installs in anaconda 4 root environment old versions due to dependencies
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/302) by Erik Kretschmer (Bitbucket: [geogob](https://bitbucket.org/geogob), GitHub: [geogob](https://github.com/geogob)).**

----------------------------------------

A clean install on osx-64 bit fails due to dependencies, more precisely install a deprecated version of mss.

With a clean/new install of anadaconda2:


```
#!bash

conda config --add channels conda-forge
conda config --add channels defaults
conda install mss
```


installs mss 1.2.2:


```
#!bash

$ conda list
...
mss                       1.2.2                    py27_0    conda-forge
...
```



Attempting to force the installation of 1.6.2 leads to UnsatisfiableError:

```
#!bash

$ conda install mss=1.6.2
Fetching package metadata .............
Solving package specifications: .

UnsatisfiableError: The following specifications were found to be in conflict:
  - mss 1.6.2* -> pyqt 4.11.* -> qt >=4.8.6,<5.0
  - mss 1.6.2* -> pyqt 4.11.* -> sip >=4.16.4,<4.18
  - navigator-updater
Use "conda info <package>" to see the dependencies for each package.
```

title: cfg pickle files of older Version cause a crash of more recent MSS under windows only
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/284) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

It seems as if some of the stored settings pickle file may still crash a newer MSS.
The desired behaviour in this case should be a simple warning and a discarding of the stored settings and return to defaults. The settings shall then be overwritten with the default settings.

title: flightstar input plugin rounds coordinates
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/283) by Jens-Uwe Grooß (Bitbucket: [grooss](https://bitbucket.org/grooss), GitHub: [grooss](https://github.com/grooss)).**

----------------------------------------

The flightstar input plugin reads in coorinates from the format xx degrees yy.zz minutes. So arc minutes wit two decimal digits.  The flitestar plugin rounds the data in decimal degrees,
in order to not display lengthy numbers in the table view.
However, if the output data are written out in the same format xx degrees yy.zz the numbers
are different in the last 1 digit which may be confusing.
Therefor I suggest to change the rounding in the flitestar pluging from 2 to 3 digits

title: DefaultDataAccess class crashes in case that two files of same vertical coordinate type have different number of levels.
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/282) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

The consistency check of the data access class tries to compare the given vertical levels of all files and skips a file if they are not consistent.
Sadly, the comparison did not take into account a differing number of levels. The comparison for different values thus crashes in case that a differing number of levels is encountered, This is obviously not intended as the desired behaviour here is also an error message and a skipping of the file.

Currently a click on the button "get capabilities" in the UI calls wms.get_capabilities. This  delivers always the same information which was once created on server process start and first request. It returns the same amount of data independent of file changes on the server by repeating a lot of methods.

We have to take care that deleting or adding server files will be handled here. A click on the UIs "get capabilities" should always show the current state of files on the server, without reinitiation the server itselfs.

title: txt export plugin broken
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/240) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

The txt plugin was seemingly broken by the Py2/Py3 support work.
A file now looks like this:


```
#!txt

Track name: b'friday'
Index  Location   Lat (+-90)  Lon (+-180)  Flightlevel  Pressure (hPa)  Leg dist. (km)  Cum. dist. (km)  Comments
    0  b'Kathman'     27.697       85.359        0.000        1013.250             0.0              0.0  b''
    1  b'A'           27.370       84.980      490.000         121.684            52.1             52.1  b''

```

The b'' ist newly introduced by the Py3 changes. This additional 3 characters break the formating of the file, preventing it from being read in, causing an Exception that crashed the MSS client.

The code needs to be modified to remove the b''.

The code should be modified not to crash the client even in the presence of an unforeseen exception. Loading a flighttrack can be simply aborted and should not crash the application.

title: Table View not properly updated in PyQt5
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/213) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

Using PyQt5, moving waypoint in top/SideView does not update the TableView properly. Only when the TableView is focused, the changed values become visible.

This may be related to 
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22560296/pyqt-list-view-not-responding-to-datachanged-signal
In PyQt5 the dataChanged signal was changed compared to PyQt4. The waypointsmodel somehow defines the dataChanged slot in the way PyQt4 used it, probably overwriting the signal improperly for PyQt5. Removing the seemingly superfluous definition of the slot removes the problem for PyQt5 and still works for PyQt4.

Server not giving WMS compliant error messages for invalid time/elevation data
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/205) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

The WMS server has an internal exception that is not caught and thus gives a wrong indication to the client. Likely a bug introduced by refactoring.

title: Server not WMS compliant for non-existing elevation levels
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/204) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

For elevation/level values, for which no data values are given, the server currently selects the data belonging to the next lower level.
According to specification, it should not do that, but give an Error.
Alternatively, the WMS specification allows the Server to specify that it will give the Nearest available level instead. In this case, it needs to indicate this behaviour in its capability document and also give an HTML warning.

The current behaviour of rounding down isn't very sensible.
As a quick fix, we could raise an Exception if the level is not present. In case of floating point values, we probably need to define a sensible error margin due to the float->ascii->float conversion involved.

The more useful behaviour would probably be returning the nearest value, but according to specification, which implies informing the client about it in HTML warnings.

title: [msschem] Not all hsecs are being offered by the client
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/163) by Andreas Hilboll (Bitbucket: [andreas-h](https://bitbucket.org/andreas-h), GitHub: [andreas-h](https://github.com/andreas-h)).**

----------------------------------------

**[This replaces https://bitbucket.org/andreas-h/mss/issues/1]**

In my setup, I add the following two data sources to the `nwpaccess` in the settings:

    "CAMSglb": mslib.mswms.dataaccess.MSSChemDataAccess(
            os.path.join(_datapath, "msschem", "cams_global"),
            "CAMSglb", "cams-global", "ml"),

    "CAMSregENS": mslib.mswms.dataaccess.MSSChemDataAccess(
            os.path.join(_datapath, "msschem", "cams_regional"),
            "CAMSregENS", "cams-regional", "al"),

I also have the following two horizontal plot styles:

    (mpl_hsec_styles.HS_MSSChemStyle_AL_NO2_mconc, ["CAMSregENS"]),
    (mpl_hsec_styles.HS_MSSChemStyle_ML_NO2_mfrac, ["CAMSglb"]),

Everything works fine, as long as I **don't** add the following vertical plot style:

    (mpl_vsec_styles.VS_MSSChemStyle_ML_NO2_mfrac, ["CAMSglb"]),

As soon as I also have this vertical layer activated, the client only offers the CAMSregENS hsec, and *not* the CAMSglb hsec.

However, I checked the WMS offer from the server (using the *View* functionality of the client), and the offers in both situations are idential (ok, except for the added vsec style).

I'm a bit at a loss here.  Since the WMS offer from the server seems identical, I don't know where to look in my server code, and I haven't touched the client, so far ...

I uploaded some test data (2.5G) to [OneDrive](https://unibremende-my.sharepoint.com/personal/hilboll_uni-bremen_de/_layouts/15/guestaccess.aspx?folderid=1a66e6db13b17483f98c63af4bac53b6a&authkey=AfmhPn50oyWMiQfG5Jv9uQ8).

title: Naming of waypoint labels
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/161) by Jens-Uwe Grooß (Bitbucket: [grooss](https://bitbucket.org/grooss), GitHub: [grooss](https://github.com/grooss)).**

----------------------------------------

If waypoints are created by the insert button, they are labelled as letters 'A', 'B', etc.
If then the location is changed (by mv button or editing the table view coordinates), the label changes to numbers (no Location label in the table view). This is somewhat confusing, and I would suggest leaving out the automatic creation of the label letters.

title: mss_settings.json cannot be loaded in mss tool at Windows 7 (64bit)
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/157) by Vladyslav Nenakhov (Bitbucket: [Vlad_IUP](https://bitbucket.org/Vlad_IUP), ).**

----------------------------------------

Dear mss developer,

my name is Vlad and i am a PhD student of Prof. Burrows (IUP-University of Bremen) and a member of organisation team of the EMeRGe campaign (take place in summer 2017 and spring 2018).

Issue: If i load a mss_setting.json file in mss on Windows 7 (64bit) from my Desktop, than no changes are applied in mss.

Details: With the help of the guide on 
http://mss.readthedocs.io/en/latest/usage.html#settings-file
i created a new mss_setting_Vlad.json (see attachment) with new locations. If load (from my Desktop) on Windows 7 (64bit) in mss via "File->Load Confoguration" my "mss_setting_Vlad.json" and go to "Table View", than the "Location" list is not updated according to my file. A restart of mss dont help also to solve this problem. I tried to load a "mss_setting.json" file from Andreas Hilboll and had the same problem as with my file. I know from Andreas that he made changes in his "mss_setting.json" on linux and the changes were directly updated in mss.

It would be great if someone could help me with this issue, because we (IUP) have to provide a "mss_setting.json" to our Scientific Steering Committee (SSC) in the next weeks.

Best regards
Vlad

Edit: i use mss 1.3.1.

title: Server sometimes fails due to possible corrupted cache files
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/118) by Jens-Uwe Grooß (Bitbucket: [grooss](https://bitbucket.org/grooss), GitHub: [grooss](https://github.com/grooss)).**

----------------------------------------

In the directory vt_cache, there are some files named *.vt_cache_pickle
They are created upon usage, likely to speed up the turn-around times.
However, sometimes the files are corrupted or not readable for the server, and then a "get capabilities" request is answered by "internal server error". This problem is always solved,
after the cache files have been deleted.

Should be repaired either by defining an exception or by generally undo the cache mechanism that may not save too much time.

title: local caching needs to take care of wms url
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/107) by Reimar Bauer (Bitbucket: [ReimarBauer](https://bitbucket.org/ReimarBauer), GitHub: [ReimarBauer](https://github.com/ReimarBauer)).**

----------------------------------------

Currently local caching does only take care about the URL parameters but not the URL itselfs.

One can fetch a lot of images and then change the URL to another one or even to some not existing.

Only get cabilities would enable to get different data.

So here we have two points to solve.

a) at the moment WMS Url becomes changed only get capabilties should be possible, all others should get inactive status

b) caching needs to take care of the Url used.

body:

----------------------------------------

The server is configured with certain layers. When creating the capability document, the server goes through the data files and assembles init and valid times for each layer.

In case no valid files are found, the layer should not be offered to the client, as this will provoke error messages on the client side.

Instead a noticeable error message should be printed to the server log file.

title: Maps do not fill the rectangular bounding box, but have white areas at the borders
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/72) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

Plotting always leaves white areas at the boundaries, which are caused by the masking of all points outside the bounding box as some workaround for clabel to work correctly.
This leaves always a white margin at the boundaries, the extent of which depends on the resolution of the underlying map.
Not masking some points outside the bounding box would remove these white areas without affect the contout labeling much.

title: Scaling with unit_scale does not work for the vertical plots in all cases
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/68) by Jens-Uwe Grooß (Bitbucket: [grooss](https://bitbucket.org/grooss), GitHub: [grooss](https://github.com/grooss)).**

----------------------------------------

**A follow-up to Issue #67**

As a solution to  Issue #67 the scaling factor unit_scale was introduced also in the vertical plots.
However, in the case of some datasets, here e.g.  "mole_fraction_of_sulfur_dioxide_in_air" in the CAMS data set, the color bar number range determined by 
cmin, cmax = Targets.get_range(self.dataname)
in mpl_vsec_styles is not defined, cmin, cmax = None
Therefore, if such plots are requested, the server returns an internal server error.

It has to be checked, whether the variables  cmin or cmax are None.
The scaling would then be determined by  curtain_cc.min(), curtain_cc.max().

The scaling should be tested for all parameters and colour bar settings, (also for species e.g. H2O, that are present in different data files)

(see utils.py).

title: non existing default config path fails on windows
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/49) by Reimar Bauer (Bitbucket: [ReimarBauer](https://bitbucket.org/ReimarBauer), GitHub: [ReimarBauer](https://github.com/ReimarBauer)).**

----------------------------------------

On a fresh installation without a common .config directory the start of mss fails
on windows

```
#!text

C:\Users\user\mss\staged-recipes\recipes\mss>mss
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\user\Miniconda2\Scripts\mss-script.py", line 3, in <module>
    import mslib.msui.mss_pyui
  File "C:\Users\user\Miniconda2\lib\site-packages\mslib\msui\mss_pyui.py", li
ne 57, in <module>
    from mslib.msui import flighttrack as ft
  File "C:\Users\user\Miniconda2\lib\site-packages\mslib\msui\flighttrack.py",
 line 46, in <module>
    from mslib.mss_util import config_loader
  File "C:\Users\user\Miniconda2\lib\site-packages\mslib\mss_util.py", line 46
, in <module>
    from mslib.msui import wms_login_cache
  File "C:\Users\user\Miniconda2\lib\site-packages\mslib\msui\wms_login_cache.
py", line 36, in <module>
    os.mkdir(DEFAULT_CONFIG_PATH)
WindowsError: [Error 3] Das System kann den angegebenen Pfad nicht finden: 'C:\\
Users\\user\\.config\\mss'

C:\Users\user\mss\staged-recipes\recipes\mss>
```

title: mss_wms_cl not working
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/48) by Reimar Bauer (Bitbucket: [ReimarBauer](https://bitbucket.org/ReimarBauer), GitHub: [ReimarBauer](https://github.com/ReimarBauer)).**

----------------------------------------


We don't have MSS_WMSResponse also nothing with a parameter address="COMMAND_LINE"

```
#!python

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./mss_wms_cl.py", line 302, in <module>
    main()
  File "./mss_wms_cl.py", line 193, in main
    wsgi = wms.MSS_WMSResponse(mss_wms_settings.nwpaccess, address="COMMAND_LINE")
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'MSS_WMSResponse'
```

title: set execute bit only on executables
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/40) by Reimar Bauer (Bitbucket: [ReimarBauer](https://bitbucket.org/ReimarBauer), GitHub: [ReimarBauer](https://github.com/ReimarBauer)).**

----------------------------------------

currently all files in the development repostiory seems to have execute bit 

on a linux System we should may be remove first all ritghts and set them afterwards to


```
#!shell


cd mss
chmod -R a-rwx
chmod -R a+rwX
chmod a+x mslib/msui/mss_pyui.py
chmod a+x mslib/mswms/mss_wms_cl.py
chmod a+x mslib/mswms/mss_wms_wsgi.standalone_paste.py
```



The last one will be replaced by e.g. mswms.py

title: remove link to bitbucket from rtfd theme
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/28) by Reimar Bauer (Bitbucket: [ReimarBauer](https://bitbucket.org/ReimarBauer), GitHub: [ReimarBauer](https://github.com/ReimarBauer)).**

----------------------------------------

the *edit* link of read the docs to the bitbucket repository uses a wrong url.
Also only maintainers could use that link. 

A hint is given at 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/36019670/removing-the-edit-on-github-link-when-using-read-the-docs-sphinx-with-readthed

title: improve UI elements for release 1.1.0
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/27) by Reimar Bauer (Bitbucket: [ReimarBauer](https://bitbucket.org/ReimarBauer), GitHub: [ReimarBauer](https://github.com/ReimarBauer)).**

----------------------------------------

* About 
  * list copyright 2015-2016 
  * hint http://mss.rtfd.io

All other elements remove DLR/IPA because developers based on various organisations

if possible edit ui and py script. Or use designer-qt4 and pyuic4

title: refactor namespace
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/24) by Reimar Bauer (Bitbucket: [ReimarBauer](https://bitbucket.org/ReimarBauer), GitHub: [ReimarBauer](https://github.com/ReimarBauer)).**

----------------------------------------

currently after we install mss we use several namespaces. This makes maintaining in a not dedicated environment difficult.

* mslib
* msui
* mswms
* thirdparty

We should move all dpependencies below mslib so that we have

* mslib
* mslib.msui
* mslib.mswms
* mslib.thirdparty
etc

title: remove links improve sys.path
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/22) by Reimar Bauer (Bitbucket: [ReimarBauer](https://bitbucket.org/ReimarBauer), GitHub: [ReimarBauer](https://github.com/ReimarBauer)).**

----------------------------------------

mss/mslib and mss/thirdparty/owslib is linked into mss/msui

This has to be solved by using sys.path.extend([..])

title: Vertical section styles not supported in standalone paste server.
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/10) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

Vertical section styles are only supported in Apache server, but not the standalone one, making testing more difficult.

title: Exceptions raised in wms_standalone server lose their context
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/9) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

When bugs in the WMS server occur and Exceptions are thrown, these are catched and reraised in a way that the origin of the Exception is lost. This makes the debugging quite hard, as it is unclear which portion of the code is responsible.

title: Labels accumulate in plots upon saving
body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/issue/5) by Joern Ungermann (Bitbucket: [joernu76](https://bitbucket.org/joernu76), GitHub: [joernu76](https://github.com/joernu76)).**

----------------------------------------

Labels appear multiple times in saved plots.
